org.jpws.pwslib.crypto

Class CryptoRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.crypto.CryptoRandom

  • public class CryptoRandom
extends java.lang.Object
    Enhanced random generator for cryptographical purposes. Claims to be thread-safe.

    This random generator is based on the SHA-512 function which is assumed to generate a set of cryptologically qualifying random values on any given data pool. The variance of the data pool is acquired by a mixture of counter increment and cyclic recollection of various system and application specific data which can be expected to shape into a random state by each call.

    Instances can be used straight away and the dominant seed sources will be time, system memory constellation and "usual" random values of java.util.Random. A good job should be expected by only this. However, an opening for additional user pool data exists with method getUserSeed() . It is called with every data pool refresh (cycle period) and can be activated through overriding in a subclass of this. Applications which are in hold of real random values on a regular basis can meaningfully use this feature.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CryptoRandom()
      Constructs a random generator under standard values for refresh cycle and random seed.
      CryptoRandom(byte[] init)
      Constructs a random generator under taking into calculation user random seed data.
      CryptoRandom(int cycle)
      Constructs a random generator with user definition of the pool refresh cycle loops.
      CryptoRandom(int cycle, byte[] init)
      Constructs a random generator with initial seed data and a definition of the pool refresh cycle loops.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CryptoRandom

        public CryptoRandom()
        Constructs a random generator under standard values for refresh cycle and random seed. The default cycle period is 8.

      • CryptoRandom

        public CryptoRandom(int cycle)
        Constructs a random generator with user definition of the pool refresh cycle loops. Higher values of cycle reduce execution cost but also might reduce long-term random quality.
        Parameters:
        cycle - int number of loops to use a single data pool incarnation

      • CryptoRandom

        public CryptoRandom(byte[] init)
        Constructs a random generator under taking into calculation user random seed data. The default cycle period is 8.
        Parameters:
        init - byte[] initial random seed data, may be null

      • CryptoRandom

        public CryptoRandom(int cycle,
            byte[] init)
        Constructs a random generator with initial seed data and a definition of the pool refresh cycle loops. Higher values of cycle reduce execution cost but also might reduce long-term random quality.
        Parameters:
        cycle - int number of loops to use a single pool incarnation
        init - byte[] initial random seed data (may be null)

    • Method Detail

      • getUserSeed

        public byte[] getUserSeed()
        Callback function to obtain the user's random seed data array in a subclass. You can override this to supply specific seed data to this generator.

        (This is an alternative method compared to recollect(). This method updates the random pool data more reliably because it is a user-passive method, compared to recollect() which is a user-active method. However, frequent recollection may be expensive in time.)

        Returns:
        byte[] random seeds

      • recollect

        public void recollect(byte[] init)
        Causes this random generator to collect a new random data pool including the user's seed data as given by the parameter.
        Parameters:
        init - byte[] user seed data or null

      • nextByte

        public byte nextByte()
        Returns a random byte value.
        Returns:
        byte

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt(int n)
        Returns a random integer value ranging from 0 including to n excluding. n must be positive.
        Parameters:
        n - int size of value range
        Returns:
        int random value

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt()
        Returns a random int value. The value ranges from Integer.MINVALUE to Integer.MAXVALUE.
        Returns:
        int random value

      • nextLong

        public long nextLong()
        Returns a random long value.
        Returns:
        long random value

      • nextBytes

        public byte[] nextBytes(int num)
        Returns a random data byte array of the length as specified by the parameter.
        Parameters:
        num - int length of output byte array
        Returns:
        byte[] random bytes

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean()
        Returns a random boolean value.
        Returns:
        boolean random value
